content.text:
How does a designer resolve a design?<image 1>

A. By sketching multiple design ideas
B. By conducting user testing
C. By creating a presentation and developing the design into a publishable format that addresses all evaluation criteria
D. By refining typography and layout

C. By creating a presentation and developing the design into a publishable format that addresses all evaluation criteria

A designer typically resolves a design by creating a presentation that showcases various design ideas, conducting user testing to gather feedback, refining typography and layout, and developing the design into a publishable format that addresses all evaluation criteria. This process ensures that the final design meets the intended goals and user needs. Therefore, the correct answer is C.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
